name: Torrijas
description: /'Drunkenness'/ Also known as French toast (though in Spain we do not use sandwich bread), it's a simple breakfast or dessert with origins in ancient Rome.

ingredients: Bread (it must be dry. What I do is when I buy a thin bread like a baguette, I slice it thin and leave it out to dry for 1 day. Then put it in a sealed bag in the freezer)

instructions: - Cut bread in ~0.5 cm slices, leave in a flat plate.
- Beat an egg in a bowl, with salt (slightly more than you would normally put on a single egg).
- Put milk in another bowl and start heating oil to cover the pan.
- Soak the bread by turning in the milk twice, and in the egg 4 times, then cook on one side until brown, flip.
- Take them out and sprinkle sugar in their center.

culinary: For me, the thinner the bread you use to do this, the better.
Some bread just doesn't work, because when you slice it thin it crumbles. For this, cut it after buying it and freeze or leave them outside until you use them.
Olive oil works well because the bread absorbs quite a bit of it. Substituting will alter the flavor.
